title: Sampler, September 16, 1806
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery, linen foundation 
Technique: stem, satin, and double running stitches on plain weave
provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 69 x 43 cm (27 3/16 x 16 15/16 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description: Alphabets, numerals and wreaths with initials, names and memorial pieces and the inscription "Gestickt von Amalie Forberger, Meissen, den 16, Sept br 1806."  (Embroidery of Amalie Forberger, Meissen, 16 September 1806.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, September 16, 1806.
September 16, 1806. Medium: silk embroidery, linen foundation 
Technique: stem, satin, and double running stitches on plain weave. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-97.
